de.mrapp.android.validation

Class Validators

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.validation.Validators

  • public final class Validators
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class, which provides factory methods, which allow to create various validators.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Detail

      • negate

        public static <Type> Validator<Type> negate(@NonNull
                                            java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage,
                                            @NonNull
                                            Validator<Type> validator)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to negate the result of an other validator.
        Type Parameters:
        Type - The type of the values, which should be validated
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        validator - The validator, whose result should be negated, as an instance of the type Validator. The validator may not be null
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • negate

        public static <Type> Validator<Type> negate(@NonNull
                                            android.content.Context context,
                                            @StringRes
                                            int resourceId,
                                            @NonNull
                                            Validator<Type> validator)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to negate the result of an other validator.
        Type Parameters:
        Type - The type of the values, which should be validated
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used to retrieve the error message, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        resourceId - The resource ID of the string resource, which contains the error message, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource ID must correspond to a valid string resource
        validator - The validator, whose result should be negated, as an instance of the type Validator. The validator may not be null
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • conjunctive

        @SafeVarargs
public static <Type> Validator<Type> conjunctive(@NonNull
                                                              java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              Validator<Type>... validators)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to combine multiple validators in a conjunctive manner. Only if all single validators succeed, the resulting validator will also succeed.
        Type Parameters:
        Type - The type of the values, which should be validated
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        validators - The single validators, the validator should consist of, as an array of the type Validator. The validators may neither be null, nor empty
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • conjunctive

        @SafeVarargs
public static <Type> Validator<Type> conjunctive(@NonNull
                                                              android.content.Context context,
                                                              @StringRes
                                                              int resourceId,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              Validator<Type>... validators)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to combine multiple validators in a conjunctive manner. If all single validators succeed, the resulting validator will also succeed.
        Type Parameters:
        Type - The type of the values, which should be validated
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used to retrieve the error message, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        resourceId - The resource ID of the string resource, which contains the error message, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource ID must correspond to a valid string resource
        validators - The single validators, the validator should consist of, as an array of the type Validator. The validators may neither be null, nor empty
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • disjunctive

        @SafeVarargs
public static <Type> Validator<Type> disjunctive(@NonNull
                                                              java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              Validator<Type>... validators)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to combine multiple validators in a disjunctive manner. If at least one validator succeeds, the resulting validator will also succeed.
        Type Parameters:
        Type - The type of the values, which should be validated
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        validators - The single validators, the validator should consist of, as an array of the type Validator. The validators may neither be null, nor empty
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • regex

        public static Validator<java.lang.CharSequence> regex(@NonNull
                                                      java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage,
                                                      @NonNull
                                                      java.util.regex.Pattern regex)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they match a certain regular expression.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        regex - The regular expression, which should be used to validate the texts, as an instance of the class Pattern. The regular expression may not be null
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • minLength

        public static Validator<java.lang.CharSequence> minLength(@NonNull
                                                          java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage,
                                                          int minLength)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they have at least a specific length.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        minLength - The minimum length a text must have as an Integer value. The minimum length must be at least 1
        Returns:
        @return The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • maxLength

        public static Validator<java.lang.CharSequence> maxLength(@NonNull
                                                          java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage,
                                                          int maxLength)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they are not longer than a specific length.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        maxLength - The maximum length a text may have as an Integer value. The maximum length must be at least 1
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • maxLength

                                                          android.content.Context context,
                                                          @StringRes
                                                          int resourceId,
                                                          int maxLength)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they are not longer than a specific length.

      • letter

        public static Validator<java.lang.CharSequence> letter(@NonNull
                                                       java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       Case caseSensitivity,
                                                       boolean allowSpaces,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       char... allowedCharacters)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they only contain letters. Letters are considered to be all alphabetical characters from A to B. It is possible to specify, whether only uppercase or lowercase letters should be accepted, or if they should be threatened case-insensitive. Additionally, it is possible to specify whether spaces should be allowed and to add special characters, which should also be accepted. Empty texts are also accepted.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        caseSensitivity - The case senstivitiy, which should be used by the validator, as a value of the enum Case. The value may either be UPPERCASE, LOWERCASE or CASE_INSENSITIVE
        allowSpaces - True, if spaces should be allowed, false otherwise
        allowedCharacters - The allowed special characters as an array of the type char. The array may not be null
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • letter

        public static Validator<java.lang.CharSequence> letter(@NonNull
                                                       android.content.Context context,
                                                       @StringRes
                                                       int resourceId,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       Case caseSensitivity,
                                                       boolean allowSpaces,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       char... allowedCharacters)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they only contain letters. Letters are considered to be all alphabetical characters from A to B.         Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • iri

        public static Validator<java.lang.CharSequence> iri(@NonNull
                                                    java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they represent valid IRIs. IRIs are internationalized URLs according to RFC 3987, which are for example used as internet addresses. Empty texts are also accepted.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

        resourceId - The resource ID of the string resource, which contains the error message, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource ID must correspond to a valid string resource
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

      • phoneNumber

        public static Validator<java.lang.CharSequence> phoneNumber(@NonNull
                                                            java.lang.CharSequence errorMessage)
        Creates and returns a validator, which allows to validate texts to ensure, that they represent valid phone numbers. Phone numbers, which are only consisting of numbers are allowed as well as international phone numbers, e.g. +49 1624812382. Empty texts are also accepted.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - The error message, which should be shown, if the validation fails, as an instance of the type CharSequence. The error message may not be null
        Returns:
        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator

        The validator, which has been created, as an instance of the type Validator
